column8: A coastal escape in the city
column11: One of the most prominent beach-fronts within the city of Colombo. It definitely is a great escape for some fresh sea air, a dip in the ocean or a gorgeous view of the sunset. Mount Lavinia still remains as a calm area compared to most of the suburbs and this makes it a great destination to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. There are also a plenty of restaurants in the area offering a great range of seafood and beverages.

column8: Mount Lavinia Beach: A Coastal Jewel of Colombo
column11: Mount Lavinia Beach is truly a jewel in Colombo's crown, a breathtaking destination that beckons travellers with its expansive beauty and serene atmosphere. This idyllic shoreline is a haven of safety and tranquillity, inviting visitors to immerse themselves in its natural splendour. Imagine strolling along the golden sands, the gentle caress of the sea breeze on your skin, and the rhythmic symphony of the waves providing a soothing soundtrack. The scenery is simply stunning, a panoramic vista of endless blue where the sky meets the ocean. Here, you can indulge in the simple pleasures of life: sip the refreshing water of a freshly opened coconut, feel the soft sand between your toes, and witness the artistry of nature unfold before your eyes. Mount Lavinia Beach is more than just a destination; it's an experience that rejuvenates the soul and leaves an indelible mark on your heart.

column8: Best Bar/Cafe on this Beautiful Beach
column11: I stayed nearby for a week with friends and visited Mount Lavinia beach daily. It's clean, has Lifeguards, fishermen and their boats (who go out in the early evening) easily accessible and....plenty of bars/restaurants right on the actual beach. After trying a few, I quickly adopted Padaradscha Beach Club as my regular. Very good food, location and the owner Eran is a great personality which is why I adopted the place as my 'Local' Recommend it

Mount Lavinia beach in Sri Lanka is a true gem of the Indian Ocean, boasting pristine golden sands and crystal clear waters that stretch as far as the eye can see. Visitors to this breathtaking beach are greeted with a postcard-perfect setting, complete with swaying palm trees and stunning views of the horizon. The warm tropical sun kisses your skin as you take a leisurely stroll along the shore, feeling the soft sand between your toes. You can't help but feel excited at the prospect of spending your day swimming in the tranquil waters or simply lounging on the sand, soaking up the laid-back atmosphere. From vibrant local eateries serving up delicious seafood dishes to thrilling water sports activities for adrenaline junkies, Mount Lavinia beach offers something for everyone, making it an exciting destination for any traveler looking to experience paradise on earth.

Despite this, the beach‚Äôs serene morning charm makes it worth a visit. A little cleanup effort could make this beautiful location even better.

Stayed here for the last night of a Mercury Tour of Sri Lanka. The hotel is in a stunning location with amazing views over the beach. The food was absolutely stunning with an amazing choice, spread over two rooms, best we encountered on our stay in the country. However the service in the restaurant was really poor. It was difficult to order a drink at the table and very slow to arrive once ordered. Used plates were not cleared and were allowed to pile up on the table. Such a shame as the food was so good. Finally as it was the last night of our tour and we were all going our seperate ways the following day we decided to go for a few drinks outside around the pool. Could not get anyone to take the drinks order until we went and found a reluctant waiter who took one look at the size of the goup, took the the first couple of orders and just left us sitting there whilst he went and started clearing plates from other tables which was quite ironic following our experiences in the restaurant. Eventually someone went and got a manager who did take the order but the drinks were very slow to arrive. In some cases well over 30 minutes. Such a shame that this level of service lets down the hotel, and spoilt what should have been a pleasant evening at the end of our tour.

Very convenient town to spend first or last nights on the island. Beautiful views on Colombo from the beach. Easy to get Colombo or South by train. Nice restaurants on the beach. Gorgeous sunsets.

It was my third visit in this Hotel. This Time i had halfbord Service. Dinner it was fantastic, food very nice elaborated with Love. My Special thanks to Mr. Dimuthu He was very kind. Best regards from Swizerland R.O
This is my first visit to this beach, we enjoyed and walked along the costal side, I definitely visit again.

I got off at the train station before Mount Lavinia and tried to walk the beach to the hotel. I immediately got approached by a man who wanted to be a guide and he followed me along the beach and pushed me for a bribe saying it was his beach. Eventually I got rid of him only to be approached by someone else. I was about to leave and take the train back to Colombo but found access to the beach on the South side of the hotel which was totally amazing and really beautiful. Completely recommend and the trains were interesting to take if you like getting off the normal touristy areas. I ended up having a really nice day but it was just unfortunate with my first interactions.
Fantastic place to eat,drink, swim and relax. There are washrooms and changing facilities plus sunbeds and umbrellas for a charge to non-residents of the Mount Lavinia Hotel.

This is the perfect place to rest and relax in the evening till late. The breeze will take away all your tiredness. The place provides tasty dishes. I loved the jumbo prawns and fried Handella. Friendly staff. Little busy over weekends. Try it.

Mount Lavinia Beach is a place closer to Colombo, it will take you around 30 minutes to get there in a car. You can see the Mount Lavinia Hotel which is one of the oldest hotels in Sri Lanka with a history of 210 years. If you are looking for a place to relax or have a nice meal there are plenty of places which server really good food. Also it‚Äôs a place around Colombo where you can have dip in the sea and watch a beautiful sun set. Usually weekend mornings you get lots of school kids doing beach runs for their sports training. You get life guards so you don‚Äôt have to worry, and shops selling swimming gear. Evenings you get people jogging, walking their dogs or just having fun. It‚Äôs a place where they organize all sorts of fun activities, like the annual sea swims, beach games, parties where any one can join, etc‚Ä¶.
Wide clean safe beach. It always crowded but there is always space to enjoy the sea here. Seeing the Mount Lavinia Hotel in the distance adds to the scenery.  Way access from the Galle Road.
If you have an extra / spare day in Colombo as we did go to Lavinia beach  as it‚Äôs great scape to enjoy de sun and view the sunset as well Bar are good nice deco and well service
Sometimes it's quite crowded with local people. The water is not clean as on other beaches in Sri Lanka. Some garbage, not very clean.

We loved the position, the sea is immediately there, restorant and bar on the beach where you can enjoy the sunset, the people who work there are courteous, and pleasant to see the small and sweet squirrels that run undisturbed on the beach. the pool is spectacular, we enjoyed the wonderful sunset every evening. Next time for sure we will be back here.
Nice and clean beach with good service and a great seafood restaurants. One is fish market style, other al local style menus.

We arrived early for a pre-booked afternoon tea and we were allowed to make use of the swimming pool free of charge. They even provided towels! The food and service was first class and thoroughly enjoyable. We liked the taste of the large leaf tea so much that the waitress kindly fetched us an empty packet so that we could buy the correct product.

You get a variety of restaurants for fresh sea food with nice some nice fancy drinks, like the Loon ta O, and many. Great place for an evening hangout and walks with friends. Should be a little cautious as there are people to rob you and bring unnecessary problems that might come up.

Totally a Tourist attraction with nice sea side restaurants and Bars , You go Chill with extraordinary view of Indian Ocean and Breath some good fresh air Highly recommend for Sea-bath , it‚Äôs a safe place to buy not recommended to go much forward Always be careful about yourself Have Fun Guy !!

A lovely cozy place where numerous beach side restaurant clientele go to. I believe since the approaches to this venue may have hangers on quite common in outside city limits areas ladies should preferably have male friends, family, husbands and/or companions. Am I paranoid? on the contrary in MMA parlance I prefer being classified as a sheep dog, if you get what I mean. I do not tolerate anyone even in the slightest degee being impolite or interacting in a-social manner with anyone. Am I saying this is a dangerous locality, I certainly am not. What exactly I am saying is don't go anywhere where you maybe vulnerable. Am I being over protective yes! I wouldn't let either my wife or sisters to walk in any non busy 100% safe area alone. Enjoyed walking up and down the beach while we stayed in Mr. Lavinia Hotel.  Quite interesting to see the change from the hotel to the local beach occupied by fisherman's boats.  You can do quite a long walk south of Mr. Lavinia Hotel.
Sudden plan make me to come here long sleep after tired of long flying time. It was a good place to relax me in a evening. Hope to go again before leaving Srilanka
Very interesting place to see sun set with mount lavinia hotel. Every time I memorised the love story of the Sri.Thomas Metland and lavinia when I see the Mount lavinia hotel.
very nice place to spend hours and hours. many restaurants over there open till midnight and night clubs as well.

Mount Lavinia Beach (by Mount Laviania Hotel) is a beach of golden sand that is extremely busy with both local people and tourists. The best aspects of it are the sunsets which are wonderful to observe and space to walk adjacent to the sea in this bustling and noisy part of the city. There are numerous places to find drinks, street food and so on. Unfortunately we are saddened by the litter and general messy nature of parts of it. If you are looking for pristine golden sands and peace, there are better places on the island.
Not quite a beach as there is more grass and weed than sand. It's a bit messy, too. Although, it is a fine spot to admire the sunset and have something local to eat.

Very nice beach. Lots of small places to buy a beer, a plate full of fruit or a nice dish of local food. Been there twice, on Independence day. Busy but not overcrowded. The day after that was even quieter with free sunbeds and lots of space. Watch out for the current and big waves when you travel with small children

If you love to see the sunset.. capture breathtaking images then a stroll down Mount beach will satisfy you.. this is if you're close to Colombo. Sri Lanka has many many beautiful lookouts.. but this is a good place for a quick drive from the city of Colombo.. walk on the beach.. maybe enjoy a drink and some food from the many restaurants by the beach!

I had dinner on the beach at the sort-of hide-away restaurant. I ordered appetizers (delicious) and fresh crab (very disappointing). They were out of large crab so I ordered two medium size live crabs which I personally selected. However, when they arrived on my dinner plate, the claws were missing, and it was difficult to be sure I actually got what I ordered. I complained to the staff but I was ensured that what I ordered was what i received.  Not so--the claws were missing, for sure. as a consequent, my high-dollar meals provided very little crab meat. My business partner gave me some claw meat from his own plate so I could actually have a meager meal. Do not order medium to small size crab--i think I was not given what I paid for or expected. Sad.

We stayed in Mount Lavinia hotel. Very Expensive. Good Food. Fantastic Experience on last day of our stay in Sri Lanka it was a treat.The beach was quiet and there was staff to be of help all day. Quiet and Peaceful. Good to sit in sun and have a drink in shade of bar. I Love Sri Lanka

Visited this beach but was disappointed in all the rubbish on it.What does it take for people to tidy up after themselves??Piles of rubbish had been heaped up, but who is going to take it away? Some parts cleaner than others but wouldnt rush to go back

Visited the beach in Aug‚Äô17. We went in the afternoon and it was quite empty but it did get crowded towards the evening. We watched the sunset and had a small meal at the restaurant. The coconut trees give you some shades and you can hire some beach-chairs. Overall it is OK but there are beautiful beaches in the East and North coast.

The Mount Lavinia Beach is far from the first in a traveler list comparing to Down South or North & East Coast beaches. In Northern Sri Lanka near Jaffna, Manalkadu beach is as beautiful as the beaches you find on the East coast. And in the South the Talalla beautiful pristine beach is unbeatable. A place to be for  untouched beach lovers!

There are some sections of the beach that are clean, but lots of it isn't! We only saw 1 rubbish bin the whole 7 days we were there & that was overflowing! There is rubbish that has been collected into black bags, but they are not taken away! If the restaurants don't clean their immediate area, then it is not done! The locals & tourists generate a good deal of rubbish that could be recycled if only the infrastructure were in place! It's a shame that this stretch of beautiful beach is marred by flotsum & jetson!

Mount Lavinia beach or "Mount" as it's referred to is probably the nicest beach within the confines of Colombo. I, and a group of friends had a few snacks and a lot of drinks at a local beach side bar. The beach is relatively clean, although it could be cleaner. I suspect the odd piece of trash is generated by the numerous bars and restaurants that line the extensive coast line. However, it is still a beautiful spectacle as the beach arches around to the famous Mount Lavinia Beach hotel. It's definitely worth a visit at night to experience the lively atmosphere and to enjoy the company of the locals, who are friendly and welcoming. You can also experience the local wildlife - dogs, cats and crows! I would definitely recommend this beach on any visit to beautiful Sri Lanka.
There are plenty of local dogs on the beach . The beach is never swept. Good to swim and have dinner on the beach eating fresh hauls from the sea .

One thing the Mount Lavini hotel could provide is service on the beach. But, the beach was clean an great swimming. Be careful if the waves are coming in. They will make you feel small as they crash down on top of you.

This place was a stone‚Äôs throw from my hotel, thus it was frequently visited. It is a very memorable experience to swim here while the sun is setting. As others pointed out, the water is not the cleanest.  Upon walking a few hundred metres up the beach, I noticed that a stormwater drain/sewer (?) drains straight into the water. Alarmingly, there was an oil spill one afternoon, unbeknownst to the swimmers already in the water!  Oil was left in the sand, and was visible in the crashing waves.  Yuck. There are countless nicer beaches in Sri Lanka, however, this is worth the visit for its location.  In the evening, locals pack the beach, creating a very lively atmosphere.

A good way to spend a Sunday. There are some shacks where you can hire a sun chair and watch the waves. Water is good to get into and friendly locals. We have enjoyed our time there and look forward to going back.

If you lived in Colombo, it would be a great escape and you‚Äôd probably risk swimming (I walked through the water and it felt a bit murky) but it‚Äôs a relaxing beach if you‚Äôre not swimming. Not crowded on weekdays, not much harassment, views all the way to the city, direct sunset views, and a line of nice seafood restaurants where you can sit in the sand. Plus trains rolling past, which I liked. Get the train if you can. A taxi or tuktuk from Fort is theoretically about 600 each way but they‚Äôll want to charge you more and wait for you.

Six English tourists aged between 11-60 visiting on a Tuesday afternoon. Beach easily reached by tuk tuk. Half an hour from Galle Face Hotel. We had a drink in a newly refurbished bar with a white picket fence, was clean, good service and comfortable, with sunbeds. Walked along beach to Mount Lavinia Hotel. You can‚Äôt access the hotel from the beach unless your a resident. Walk along the train track and up through main entrance. Ate lunch on the terrace, then jumped in a tuk tuk. Beach was quiet, no boats for hire, one stall selling balls ect. A handful of beach bars. Nice sand, lovely locals, but a little bit of litter. You could catch the train from here near the hotel. We worked out they seemed to come about every 45 minutes.
It is a clean beach with many restaurants. It is a great beach to swim or go fo a nice walk. There are people selling souvenirs, but they do not hassle you too much.
Have been here several times now & have never been disappointed . Meal as always beautiful , the service fantastic. Love the old colonial building & the views are great .

its located in mount levinia. this beach is look like a arugamby in here you can get every food. and cheapest accommodation. this place you most use the train transportation to Colombo then you can see the clearly view of the beach.
A perfect place for a lazy sunday afternoon and then watch the nice sunset. it offers a wide variety of seafood restaurants and bars to enjoy the evening as well.
The beach was safe, waves not too big, great to see families out in force having fun. Lots of places to stop if you walk *towards* Mount Lavinia Hotel. Don't walk the other direction
This beach is an hour away from Colombo city. There are a lot of restaurants and bars alongside the beach. Good for walking!
A very nice clean beach with lots of food and drink to stop for... Can walk or sunbathe.. The sea can be a little rough at times,  but as long as you are careful should be fine..
Our hotel has very best private beach. Clean, has showers. Couple of restaurants, no locals. We went for New Years Holidays, it was perfect. Mild waves.

Mount Lavinia Beach is closer to Colombo.it is not so clean , but Compare to various City Beach, it is better.Morning Very Good For Barefoot walk on Beach.Close to one of the Famous Heritage Hotel,Mount Lavinia.You  Can spot lot of Trains from the Beach.Locals as Well as Tourists will come for Beach walk and Sea Bath.You can spot of Lot of Fishermen Entering see and coming back with Bounty. There are some Good Sea Food Restaurants .

Very good beach. Went in November with my son and his family from Australia. They just loved it. Had lunch at Mt. Lavinia Hotel. Beautiful place and had a lovely meal. The buffet spread was just fantastic. Enjoyed it. The children too had a wonderful time and they enjoyed every minute of the beach and later the dip in the hotel pool.

This is a beach in the middle of Colombo. You can really say it is a "city-beach". It's not very beautiful or clean but there is some good restaurants and sunbeds if you want to enjoy the sun. You can have a swim in the water as well but be careful the waves can get high.

The beach itself is soft sand but there is litter everywhere which is a shame. There are a couple of places with sunbeds with modest charges. There are a lot of derelict buildings and empty bars etc. Lots of locals use the beach which is great but it does need to be cleaned.

When we went there it was still the monsoon season, the tail end of it, so the beach had red flags. However, there was a nice restaurant/bar right on the beach. They served all types of drinks and freshly made seafood. We had Margaritas and beers with our friends. If you are not staying at the hotel you can a small fee that allows to use their pool as well as the beach.
Spent a pleasant afternoon on this beach. A few restaurants to have a meal or drinks. People selling items on the beach. Sand nice and beach clean.

Golden sand, ocean very strong, check the signs or ask if it's good to have a bath. The view is perfect and the place is very well equipped with the seafood restaurant, surfs and people to ask informations are really kind.

We were there when it was raining and very windy. The waves were very strong. The sand wasn't fine but still acceptable, but there was quite a fair bit of trash in the section we were at. Do be careful when getting to the beach as one has to cross the train track that runs parallel to the beach.
One of the best picks for a day out or and evening in Colombo. The beauty of the beach during the evening with the sunset is truly beautiful and soothing. Great for an evening.

Lovely place to unwind after a hectic work day. Nice place to visit with family n best time to visit wud b in evening during weekends. You wud experience a western culture influence. Caters to all age requirement. If ur a vegetarian don't forget to fill urself before visiting. You wud have nothing to be offered with !! Carry an umbrella if u visit during monsoon days cos there is no shelters other than hotelss to seek respite ...

Unlike the Negombo beach,this Mount Lavinia beach the water is very calm and not wavy as the Negombo one. A few good restaurants and discos along the beach and very,very crowded at week-ends,particularly on Sundays when it gets very busy indeed and noisy from the young crowd dancing and singing and it is really a very nice scene. Its worth visiting this place if you are a beach lover.  Don't give it a miss.
It‚Äôs a local beach.  Nice to see the locals out and about.  Definitely not a tourist trap, but somewhat boring... Not recommended.
This was the best of the Colombo trip!! Had high-tea here while it was raining. Loved the view/ food/ open sitting and everything about this place!
only 1/2 an hour drive from Colombo city,Excelent fresh sea food, sea side, soothing breeze, amazing feelings.

We spent several weeks in a Mount Lavinia budget beach hotel eating mostly in a beach restaurant, which was cheep but with descent food and inexpensive beer. It was close to the train track, but it  did not bother too much. The sandy beach is very long - not too many people. The nearby Mount Lavinia luxury hotel was much more expensive providing private beach.
Best place to visit is Sea Spray at the Berjaya hotel for drinks, relaxing and good food... You can also enjoy the sunset...

More sand in the beach than normal west coast beaches. Could be maintained better. Children had skin allergy after playing in it. Not sure if it on account of the cleanliness of the water. May be because of the drainage water which is let into it nearby.

Go on early morning or in the evening to spend a relaxing time. I went with my family and my daughter had an awesome time playing on the beach and also playing with water rafts. Collecting different types of sea shells and don't forget to hydrate well with tropical fruit juices available in near by restaurants. Also we loved the Loon tao restaurant near by. Loon Tao is the expensive side but their food and drinks are very good.

Mount Lavinia Beach could be lovely but is not looked after.  It is covered in litter and the local people don't seem to notice.  It's a real shame, because it could be a great tourist attraction.  The Mount Lavinia Hotel is nice and the village is pretty, but spoilt by the unloved beach.

Wish we had spent more time there. The beach was empty which was a good thing. Didn;t walk very far to check out the area, but it seemed like a fun place to relax and spend a nice day swimming and chilling out. Just 15 minutes away from the beach and inside the village, check out the turtle conservation project. Run by a husband and wife, they charge 1000 LKR per head.

The hotel is a throw back to a previous Colonial life and is an oasis in a hustling bustling city. The swimming pool is child friendly and it also has access to a beach where a variety of beach food is available - including freshly cooked, freshly caught sea food. Nice but the Galle Face hotel is so much nicer.
I ate at Mount Lavinia which was delicious, but was so sad by the dirtiness and garbage filled beach here.:(
Better than Galle face green in terms of cleanliness. But there are stray dogs wondering. During rainy season the beach area shrinks by a large margin.
Nice beach & beautiful sunset. There some places parties at night . it is good place having fresh sea food . not so good for swimming, snorkeling because currents in this month.
Very unclean... Just awful rubbish everywhere Restaurant lacking in hygiene standards To many hawkers interrupting dinner

Mount Lavinia Beach is located just out of the Colombo city, it took long time to go there from our hotel located in the Colombo city Centre. It‚Äôs a nice place to roaming around the sea side with sands. The beach was not crowded during our visit, it was very hot and humid day. One can see the Mount Lavania Hotel from the beach, which is one of the oldest renowned hotel in Colombo. There are some Sea Fish restaurants available beside the beach. One can also enjoy famous Srilankan coconut water from the small shops near the beach.

Beautiful beach. But the sea is treacherous with under currents. Being a resident of the area we have seen so many deaths due to drowning. Humbly request all visitors NOT to get into water but enjoy the beach.

If you enter the beach near the hotel, be sure to walk up the beach - away from the hotel and the guys who'll ask for 1000 rupees to sit on the beach - and you'll find a nice relaxed couple of bars and the same sand and ocean that you'll find outside the hotel.

One side of the beach view is Mount Lavinia hotel, the other side is the Colombo port. On the weekends, bus loads of people come from the villages or outer colombo to visit this place. Locals swim in their clothes or underwear (especially men and boys).  Youngsters play touch rugby on the beach.  There are some small stalls that sell beach balls, blow up balloons, cut fruits, drinks, snacks etc.  After the weekend, the beach is littered with garbage from the crowds.  Need proper bin facilities on the beach so it can stay beautiful for locals and tourists.

I got here just before the sunset and I was awe-inspired to see the beautiful sunset it had to offer. One can get here by train or can simply take any southbound bus from Colombo and get down here. Transports to and from Colombo are frequently available from here. I would recommend people to get to this beach just fir its brilliant sunset. Would love to go back there someday.
Peaceful. Tranquil. Amazing. Great for a good walk . Refreshing breeze . Good for a swim during the non sunny hours.  Tends to be crowded during weekends.
Good if you're looking for a place to sit down in the evening, there are so many restaurants along the beach you can choose.

Just like any other beach. Few fast food corners along the beach. Few people taking a dip in the warm waters. Mostly sandy with few rocks. Best thing is life guards on duty with watch towers along the beach.
As long as you walk the South end of the beach it's OK. Further North passed the fishermen it gets a bit smelly. Enjoyed watching the fishermen bringing in their catch

Really nice seating arrangements. Impressive collection of fresh seafood. Loved the multilingual singers on the beach. Food was of highest quality and taste. One if the best place to have a candle night dinner right on the beach. A must destination during colombo visit

I am not much interested in beaches where a lot of crowd gathers.It is no difference in here either as locals and foreigners crowded the place. Still if you can find a small corner in a pub or a cabana , it is a good place to relax. And the evening sunset is pleasing to the eye

Nice beach but I don't recommend people to have a swim. The sunset is breathtaking on some days.. when crossing the railway pls be extra careful!! There are couple of restaurants to have a dinner out with friends n family. Especially there's a good restaurant onto your left as you cross the railway called Shore by O. I went there, and I would be happy to recommend it to you guys !!! üòÅ

Although not recommend to swim in this strech of beach,you get other fun activities.you get lines of cabanas in which you can relax or read or even sip aglass of beer.you get fruit vendors coming with pinnapples bannanas  juicy mangos etc.

In comparison with other beaches of Sri Lanka, Mount Lavinia Beach is rather terrible. But then, if you're just looking for a place to sit down in the evening and have a couple of beers, it's absolutely worth a trip. If you're going to any nice beaches in the south of the island you don't miss out on anything if you skip Mount Lavinia Beach.
A great place to view the sunset while having a couple of beers. There are many restaurants along the beach you can choose.

We usually go early morning when it's cool and the beach isn't so crowded.  The kids enjoy paddling and making sand castles. Not safe for swimming due to dangerous currents. The beach really comes alive in the evenings with a glorious sunset over the Indian Ocean. ...many sea food restaurants and beach parties.
Good beach  can walk along safe next the beach railway  track good view have good restaurants some foods  are reasonable rates some  are expensive always lot of people fun

Clean and well organised place. Of course good location as it is attached to the very nice hotel. You can find really tasty and well cooked food or directly on the beach, or in the hotel. Service was also fast.
It's a nice beach. Full of fun and parties. At night there are dance parties near beach. Might be the good place for sea food lover

Beautiful sunset over the Indian ocean especially so when there is cloud & you can see sun rays as the sun sets over the horizon. Manage to view double rainbow as the sky opens up with a short shower.
Sorry to say we were not impressed with this beach it was quite scruffy and there are a lot of places just full of rubbish... Could be nice if locals made an effort to give it a good tidy....
May be not be the most clean  or dazzling  beach but this is always been my best hangout place in Colombo. There are plenty of restaurants along the beach so food is never an issue here.

It was a nice enough place to walk on the beach, but there wasn't a whole lot going on there. I did see a few restaurants around and there were some locals with fishing boats, which is a nice cultural touch. I think there are probably some nicer beaches on the island, but if you're in Colombo and looking for a place to see the water, then this will work.

My wife and I  stayed  for 3 nights  on our journey  to Sri Lanka. We really enjoyed  our  room  / direct sea view  on the  4th  floor. I approached  the manager  and booked another  4 nights  after  our  trip  to  Kandy. I must  say  he was  very  helpful  and we had  the same  room  on our return. Over  a great  stay and nice  hotel  for a relaxing  holiday

Overall beach is nice. However it was bit crowded when i went on sunday. Beach sand quality was not too good as it was black at some places. Plus the jojo food vendor experience was pretty bad. 4 star for the beach.

Not recommended to swim here, the undercurrents can get really strong and pull you out to sea. The mount Lavinia hotel has a private stretch on this beach that's nice and well maintained-- available to use for a small fee.

Ideal for early morning meditation and Evening relaxation, this beach is one of my favourite out of all the places in the western province, Mount beach is kept tidy and clean always and there are various types of restaurants to have a good meal as well. This beach is good for swimming in the morning and before 6.30pm since after 7pm the tides become rough and it might pull you further into the sea. Overall I would always choose this place to go for a evening picnic or morning walk/meditation.

A beautiful beach next to the railway station and approx 30 mins drive from central Colombo - the place had a nice vibe and topography with a number of local restaurants and bars to relax and enjoy the view. Considering this is a "city beach" it was very clean. On the other side of the railway tracks is a busy suburb with lots of shopping options (big and small) and restaurants etc
well maintained hotel , good food and service , the sea view from the restaurant is amazing, a must visit place

The staff at the Mount Lavinia were so welcoming and always happy to help you. The hotel has some beautiful surroundings and is perfect to relax before trips out later. A member of staff named Tarick was kind enough to show us around the hotel and always greeted us with a warm welcome. Seeing Staff happy to see you makes your stay feel so special. VIP tours are also based there and offer plenty of information on trips you may wish to go on. Himari has been fantastic in organising our tour around Sri Lanka. Thank you Tarick and the staff of Mount Lavinia.
safe place for sea bathe and play around . 2 km away from HIMO GUEST INN  where we feel at home.  fresh water bath after the sea bathe is fantastic.
We went here 3-4 times. But all times there was no season here to swim. Anyway I would like not to swim in Colombo. But to sit and enjoy sea cove restaurant on the beach - this is must have.

Nice beach comparatively bigger than ones in Colombo. Fairly clean, waters can be a bit rough. Some nice restaurants along the beach. Good for jogging or long walks or even a dip during the calmer seasons. The beach gets very crowded in the evenings so better chances of enjoying more during mornings or afternoons. Keep an eye on personal belongings as some dodgy folk do tend to hang around.
went there for an afternoon drink and a walk on the beach. Had a nice atmosphere on the beach, customer service was ok. not great, had to wait a while for our order?

I got the opportunity to visit Mount Lavinia Beach on the business trip. I visited this place along with my colleagues and we spent a perfect musical night here. The performance from the local team was excellent and having a group dinner with top management team was memorable.

Stayed around Mount Lavinia - not by choice but due to injury - for a couple of weeks which was really 13 days too long. Fine for a stopover (which was my intention) on the way from the airport but I wouldn't recommend longer than 2 days. Beach was rammed the whole time I was there and not much else around other than taking a quick look at the Mount Lavinia Hotel although why anyone would stay there is beyond me as some lovely small hotels in vicinity. If you walk to North end of beach there is a great place to watch the locals fishing but - as with most fishermen - they tend to look at you as an unnecessary nuisance so keep your distance. Sadly saw a young woman get mobbed and groped on the beach by a crowd of young lads who seem to roam around far too regularly. They were eventually chased off by shack owners but she was understandably distraught. It didn't feel safe to leave any belongings on the beach whilst you had a swim either.
Lovely beach and lovely setting, but soon after a swim there my son came down with acute gastro. Was it the water? Not sure but I wouldnt go back.....

I have nostalgic memories of this beach going back to the 80's. Yesterday I returned with my teenaged kids for an afternoon walk. The place looks pretty much the same. Sadly there is a lot of garbage on the beach, but I think there was less garbage than a few years' ago. There are quite a few good eating joints on the beach itself. Parking can be tricky, we got lucky and parked right near the beach. Otherwise best to park along the raid near St Thomas' College. Do take care when crossing the open rail track.
Good place to visit with children. Very nice Sun set can be seen. A lot of foreigners are Lso there...
Away from city, tough to reach while crossing the Colombo traffic...however a nice decent beach...Surely there must be better beaches in Sri Lanka...

The public beach was quite dirty when we went. The private beach of the mount lavinia hotel is what I recommend (they also have a pool). The ideal is on saturday with pool access+buffet for 2000 LKR per person

This used to be the place to go and run up to Mount Lavenia Hotel all along the beach and have a great swim even though the currant was quite unexpected and often you ended on the rocks well I did . Now its a place filthy with garbage scattered all  over the place from plastic bottles to all kinds of trash washed on the beach as the rain water drain from the streets run on to the beach between the  Golden mile and the hotel . Do not swim on this beach as the sewerage plant is close by and they pump the sewerage just off the beach and not six miles into the poor ocean as recommended. The restaurants that should not be on beach as its against the laws are built by the corrupt without any regard to the environmental impact of their effluent draining into the sea the law states that no building should be built within 60mtrs of the beach. Go elsewhere many beautiful beaches down south past Galle  or north past Negambo  .
perfect escape. i love this place , wanna visit again , i think sri lanka has most wonderful beaches

Five friends - all work colleagues - made a trip to Sri Lanka for a long weekend. Mt Lavinia Hotel was on our must do list of places to see. THe legendary story of the famous dancer and the conservative Englishman who fell in love and lived in this former governors mansion has become the stuff of legend We arrived around 6 pm into the large lobby of this iconic hotel and walked immediately to the beach. There we kicked off our shoes and ran onto the sands which were clean and free of glass pieces and shards.. what we encounter in many Indian beaches.. The beachside sea food restaurant was brimming with fresh fish and the staff welcomed us with a lovely MOCKTAIL. THe beach was not crowded and the breeze was gentle and almost dreamlike. This was a great curtain raiser for an evening that took us to the large buffet inside the hotel Walking on the sands and listening to the waves crash onto the brown sands.. the ebb and rise of the tide.. getting our feet wet and feeling the sand squish amidst our toes.. Our group of women ranging from ages 38 to 63 were in various stages of girlish delight Do visit Mount Lavinia beach before you dine or drink. This is like a superb trailer for the main feature that is the incredible island of Sri Lanka

Booked a night here as my husband used to stop here when flight crew pilot years ago and he wanted to see it again. First impression was great, nice staff, room etc everything you'd expect from hotel of this quality. However, when we arrived at 5 pm we asked to book a table in the a la carte restaurant for 7.30 we were told it was full booked, We asked if we could have a table on the terrace or elsewhere and were told everywhere full. So we finally agreed after some discussion we could have a table at 9pm. When we arrive no one knew anything about it....but we did get a table where we sat for some time before a wine waiter appeared. We ordered a bottle of Fizz and waited, and waited after 20 minutes our bottle and bucket appeared  but no.... the waiter disappeared again! By now the couple on the table next to us had noticed, they were still waiting for their a la carte food to arrive. My husband then opened our bottle and we were on the second glass before the waiter re-appeared. It was now nearly 10 pm and our neighbours food had appeared and was promptly rejected as cold. So we went for the buffet - not great but we could find something to eat. It was very average more 3* than 5*. Our neighbour was a business man who frequently stayed at the Hotel and said he had never experienced anything  like it before we concluded the hotel was suffering from too many guests and not enough staff. There seemed to be a lot of "groups" staying. And maybe it was going package. Breakfast much later in the morning and after a swim in the lovely pool was a far happier affair, most having gone through the dining room by then. So potentially a great place to stop with a lovely beach and beach bar, we left before lunch for a small boutique hotel in town and were not sorry.

We wanted to swim in the Indian Ocean just once whilst in Sri Lanka so,decided to,take a hotel car south to Mount Lavinia. Despite a very comfortable, air conditioned car it took ages to reach the hotel from central Colombo. We just looked entitled and walked through hotel to beach hut where there were changing rooms with showers,lavatories and sun loungers. A tip to attendant meant nice fluffy towels and a prime spot under the umbrella. The spot was beautiful. The s a as deliciously warm but not for faint hearted - huge, powerful, surf and a noticeable rip. There was a lifeguard but we had no idea of his swimming ability and he had no equipment to assist anyone in difficulties. I wouldn't let children swim in sea here. Around the other side of the hotel (and we think accessible by walking around from public beach) was a more sheltered place for swimming, protected by large rocks breaking the waves. There was a pool bar and restaurant on the beach. We ate lunch in the lounge - it was good and reasonably priced as we shared a pizza and single portion of chips ( portions were huge). We decided to try Sri Lankan trains for journey back to Colombo. It was very, very cheap. Train arrived on time (we googled) and we had seats. It was quicker than car taking about 25 minutes from Mount Lavinia to Colombo Fort. We saw so much that way. Trains weren't exactly comfortable but were ok.

Nice little area to kick back and chill out. Restaurant bar under a straw hut for shade or shelter from the rain. Nice quiet beach to check out.

Mt Lavinia gives the impression of being slightly upscale and it probably is - the beach is good by general standards but is nothing compared to what lies nearby (Galle, Hikkaduwa etc). Lots of establishments on the beach as well. Not particularly dirty or crowded, but better options exist.

What would it take to clean up the beach? Two persons with a bin, twice a day, and you could quickly transform it into a must visit attraction. As it stands, too dirty, area around railway tracks feels unsafe, but surf looks  and feels stunning. Easy to get to from Colombo with Uber taxi.   Less than half an hour.

My friend and host in Colombo, and his family, were my guests for lunch yesterday at this beautiful hotel resort overlooking the Indian Ocean. We went for a short walk along Mount Lavinia Beach after lunch. Beautiful beach and scenic views but hot and humid .... Appropriate that this Beach was the last of several beaches I visited along Sri Lanka's Southern Coast before returning to Dubai last night.

You dont feel like a stranger here, the owner and her staff make sure you feel at home. Just a few steps to the beach and close to the City as well. Shopping and Food all in walking distance. Facilities are clean and the garden nicely manicured. Overall a wonderful stay with squirrels, goldfish and colorful birds greeting you at the gate.

Beach is clean and has a long sea front with great waves. Lovely place for families and friends. Only concern is that there is only one life savers which covers a long stretch. I did not see any Life guards doing a walk around to check up on things.

the beach is very large and had lots of huts. beaware of stray dogs and also the vendors which sell stuff . their prices are v high and stuff they sell are very expensive and not up the standard.also be the waves are very big and surfinh has to be done with care . And also there are life gurads too

Enjoy the vibrancy of this beautiful beach next to the Mount Lavinia hotel, surrounded by a variety of sea side restaurants.  Perfect for a late afternoon get away from the bustle of the city.  You may even catch a spectacular sunset

The beach is not far down from Colombo, easy commuter train ride (crowded but friendly) and available by  bus on Galle road, and of course tuktuk or cab.  Restaurants are available, few tourists, mostly locals.  Do not venture north too far as there are slums on the beach where fishermen live, You will be accosted by children and young men looking for hand outs.

This is a public beach, which however has limited public access due to hotels and restaurants on the waterfront. Follow Beach rd down and cross the tracks to get to the waterfront. The sand is mostly clean. There are numerous hawkers. Scuba diving and fishing boats leave from the region. You can get a chair and umbrella by purchasing drinks/food at some of the hotel/restaurants.

It's a nice beach and has been redeveloped in recent years.  There are many eateries on the beach now and they're varied in taste.  Lots of beach bars as you'd expect.  It's a pleasant stroll down the beach on a quiet day.
Was there almost after sunset, it was a cool place with many seaside restaurants. Good to enjoy a drink and food.
Very quite although its in the middle of a big city. A little bit rough sea, but no worry. Was part of the movie bridge of river quai.

I had to change room 3 times the first day. Very old, humid, dark and bad smelling rooms without sea view until my last room, which was OK. Service in the reception was very slow. I was asked to check out already at 11 am, as they said that a lot of tourist would come. I was then sitting in the lobby up to 3 pm and was waiting for the airport drop. During those 4 hours noone checked in at the hotel, but many guests checked out! Breakfast buffet very good. Hotell overpriced, not value for money.

column7: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
column11: If you are looking for a 5 star service and quality and you are picky about standards don't go there.
We stayed at Berjaya and the beach is right next to the hotel. Its quite crowded and not recommended for a serene walk. However there are many good joints nearby and you will love the local food.

Except for the private area attached to the Mount Lavinia hotel the beach could be better maintained.. best to focus on he ocean and distract your eyes from the scattered garbage. Like most beaches around the world, caution is required when walking the beach . Some good beach restaurants.

It's a good beach for walks and bathing.  People of all ages come  here to relax and enjoy. Smell of the fresh air and the feel of the sea breeze  makes it so pleasant.  Very lively place specially during the evening and weekends.
Atmospheric terrace pool great for a g+t sundowner, lovely food. Would love to have stayed longer, at least two nights. Traffic there was terrible, however.

We were day visitors here and for a few dollars had access to all the facilities.  Kept clean by very diligent staff, this lovely course sanded beach was home to a lively collection of chipmunk/squirrels, not sure, whose actions were enormously entertaining.   We were provided with a woven umbrella, and sun beds.    Very peaceful, the season not yet underway, but the staff all gearing up for it.   Will return to stay at the hotel, very Downton Abbey!
Excellent beach for family summer vacations. Nice sandy beach. Local people are very friendly and caring. I have travelled there in 2004
The beach is beautiful and really long there are some interesting small shops all over the beach they mostly serve sea food.

Really very nice place to visit in Colombo. The Mount Lavinia beach was very neat & clean. The sunset view was very great from here. Hotels & restaurant near by are very good. I love this place & enjoyed a lot.
Mount Lavinia beach is good place for enjoying. Meny people and meny restaurants on beach. Clean and beautiful place.
Very nice beach very beutifull in morning with sunrise and there many many thinga to do like beach lunch.
Attended a wedding and the ball room was grand and looked its vintage best. Really friendly staff and always helpful. Good for a valet park and also easy to access all areas of the hotel. Love it !
This is an awesome beach so clean and inviting the sunset was beautiful We sat and had dinner watching it go down
Beach is too rough to swim but was lovely. Babu bar had fantastic food. It's about a half hour tuk tuk ride from central Colombo
This is a best beach in Colombo city which is famous with local and foreign travelers. there are small restaurants to have somelocal foods.

The view is beautiful. Sea is rough. Lotsa cafe along the beach. There are 2 trains stations (mount Lavinia and Dehiwala). Not too crowded in December. The crowd is nothing like Thai beaches. I think more people will go to Galle or Matara for Sri Lankan beaches but Mount Lavinia is a good place if you do not want to go too far away from Colombo City Centre.

Mount Lavinia beach used to be the place to be a few years back and you can still see a good stretch of beach where families enjoy a leisurely stroll or couples watch the sunset. The stretch of restaurants dotting the area are also intriguing. However, despite several beach clean ups done by numerous concerned groups, the beach still seems dirty, especially during the monsoon season and long weekends. Still, its the best beach close to Colombo, just take a beach blanket and soak in the Lankan sunshine

Few people at the beach, on a windy day. A few beach hotels and restaurants. Water is warm, lots of waves. Further away where the fishing boats lay, are traces of oil in the sand. Pity that garbage is lying around further up at the fisherman houses. Why don't people recycle? I saw lots of plastic, old fridge, etc.
we visited in the afternoon so the beach was not so crowded with no activities. its but a good clean beach.
this is located at the south of colombo, famous mount lavinia hotel is located nearby this beach. in the night, there are some parties in the beach hotels here. night view is great.

A 45-minute drive from Colombo (en route Galle) Mt. Lavinia beach is best visited in the evenings when it isn't too hot. You can find the legendary 'orange coconut' here, plus the beach is lined with interesting sea-food eateries.

This is a popular tourist attraction in Colombo district. Many restaurants, hotels, speciality lodging, beach parties, recreational activities including SCUBA diving make the place lively year round. The Mount Lavinia Hotel which itself is an attraction is a must visit on the beach. It s a modification of a governor's residence in British Era. Can be recommended as a place to relax.
It was packed with people in the evening as they are having an evening fair with kites flying in the air. Only thing missing is mobile toilets for people patronising the beach.

this is the nicest beach in colombo. at a time when the beaches are dissapearing due to global warming and the port extension mount lavinia still retains a lot of its beach. lots of great places to eat at along the beach. and a decent place for a swim. be cautious though as there are currents in the ocean and the life guard is stationed in the middle of the entire beach. just one guy.
Mount Lavinia is one of the best beaches I've seen in Sri Lanka. Recently I had visited there with my friends. It was indeed a nice experience there. One of the cleanest beaches I've ever seen.
It is a nice beach a little away from the centre of colombo and a good evening to roam around and see the place and have a bite to eat

This is a gorgeous beach with no dirt. along the side merchants  sell local food... kids and families play in the sand and the teenagers play volleyball... a very very relaxed atmosphere... my mother and I very much enjoyed our stroll today.
Very good to go their with family. Its safe and clean by all means. One can play and enjoy with the regular waves.
Well our fabulous Tuk tuk driver came with us on the old train from Colombo to Mt Livinia . We had drinks, swam and had lunch on the beach at Mount Breeze hotel. It was a beautiful day , top day.

This place takes you away from the regular hustle bustle of the city for some calm and quiet moments. Enjoy watching the waves lap up the shore and spend your day in beautiful solitude. This is an ideal beach destination in Colombo and has extensive options to relax, eat and drink on the beach. It is around 10 kms from Colombo and we took a train from Colombo Fort station. On reaching, walk towards Mt Lavinia hotel and then walk down a small lane, cross the railway tracks and enter the beach area. We had a decent lunch in Shelton Seafood restaurant. The sandy shores and the peaceful beach time is a reason good enough to be here!

Go there when you want to be lonely. You're also welcome there when you're with company too. This beach stretch is something which you will never say no to even in the middle of the night or in a Sunday morning. I went there with a few friends to find out that it is the total opposite of Galle Face Green but the bliss is doubled.You find the shops at a certain area where they sell food, another series of shops where they sell swimming suits and other equipment you will need in the beach. Price is going from mid to high range. This place is populated mostly with foreigners but locals also prefer to come.

It is a lovely beach with a historic hotel. You can go for a swim but get in where there are lifeguards and signs indicating that it is safe to bathe there. You get some nice restaurants and other hotels too, offering very nice foods of you choice. However, access to the beach is not that impressive. The government should do something about it. A good beach should have many good access points and most access points are not that impressive, including the access from College street side. You get good cabanas and that is a  living experience. The rocks in the sea has many attractions to young studying sciences, Salamanders, lichen, sea weeds, crabs, small beautiful fish trapped in the rock pockets during ebb, barnacles etc but be careful as they are bit slippery. The sand area washed by the waves have muscles and other shell animals. However, there are currents that you have to be aware of, else you will get drawn into the sea. When I was a teenager I got caught not being a good swimmer or having the required floating gear I just dived down and hugged the sands and crawled myself past the current, which looking up, I saw as a tube of twirling waters. They are not that forcefull down at sand level due to viscosity and bernauly theorem.
Excellent atmosphere, great food and scenery.Great sitting on the outside terrace looking at the beach etc.
Stopped here for dinner on our first night. Restaurants on beach reasonably priced compared to the others we visited on our tour round Sri Lanka.
A small strip of beach with rough sand. Is home to a number of beach restaurants which are expensive
must visit place in colombo. Local cuisine can be tasted. Lot of funfilled activities going around. Cheerful environment

This is the best place on earth for me. I have travelled to few countries and saw various cities in my life but for me this is the best place on earth. Beautiful beach, plenty of restaurants to choose, beautiful people, fun activities, wedding location, beautiful mount Lavinia hotel etc so what more could you ask for! Love it!

Mount Lavinia Beach is easily one of the most peaceful beaches I have ever been to. There is no bothersome crowd and you can be alone with your thoughts. There are restaurants where you can go in and have a quick refreshing beer and maybe some snacks. At night they actually set up tables on the beach and you can have a great dinner under the starlights as the seemingly infinite ocean spreads in front of you. It almost feels magical. Highly recommended for romantic dinners.

There is a common beach in Mount Lavinia but there is one private beach inside of Hotel Mount Lavinia which is awesome.  Unfortunately it was heavy rain when i went there but the outlook of the beach was great, had bar closer to the beach and you get good cooked fish next to the beach which is awesome.

10km off the capital city, Mount Lavinia beach is one of the places to relax, exercise, and have some great meals. Even though its a bit away from Colombo, you can get a good view of the sky rises and the port of Colombo from there. The beach runs for about 3km ending up at the famous Mount Lavinia Hotel boundary. Recommended times to visit are the morning and the evening with plenty of restaurants offering mouth watering cuisine to fit anyone's budget!
Beautiful beach. With shacks serving local delicacies and drinks. Good for a leisurely dinner with friends.
Had a lovely evening under the stars enjoying fresh sea food cooked various ways on the beach. Quality of food and ambience both were fantastic!
This beach is a better place to visit.. from here we can see more beautiful scenes in colombo.. beautiful beach at the night mostly...

This is a place we go to enjoy a family union. We take our pet dogs for a swim early in the morning before people get in to the sea. The best part is there is ample restaurants around for any kind of meals. Good for romance as well.

This patch of the beach is famouse among local and foreign tourists. It is close to Colombo City. few minutes drive to Mount Lavenia. It is next to the Mount lavenia hotel. Lot of people come here to play, walk on the beach. I don't see it is a good place for a bath as the shallow stretch is very small. You can try if you are a good swimmer. many drowning cases report from here every year. Now lot of restaurants and hotels are there by the beach and you can buy your needs. Lot of beer shops are also available
